information: This is a rematch for the UFC bantamweight title, scheduled to headline UFC 316 on June 7-8, 2025, in Newark, New Jersey. In their first fight at UFC 306 in September 2024, Merab Dvalishvili defeated Sean O'Malley by unanimous decision to win the championship. Commentator Joe Rogan has questioned how O'Malley gets past Dvalishvili's abilities, and former champion Henry Cejudo has referred to Dvalishvili as the greatest bantamweight of all time.

forecast.time_left_until_outcome_known: Approximately 12-13 days until UFC 316 on June 7-8, 2025
forecast.status_quo_outcome: Yes - Merab Dvalishvili defeats Sean O'Malley. As the reigning champion who already defeated O'Malley by unanimous decision at UFC 306 in September 2024, Dvalishvili is the favorite heading into this rematch.
forecast.no_outcome_scenario: Either fighter sustains an injury in the final days before UFC 316, causing the fight to be cancelled or postponed. Alternatively, O'Malley wins the rematch through a knockout or decision, reclaiming the bantamweight title.
forecast.yes_outcome_scenario: Both fighters make it to fight night healthy, and Dvalishvili successfully defends his bantamweight title against O'Malley, either through his superior wrestling and pressure fighting style leading to another decision victory, or potentially finishing O'Malley.
forecast.rationale: With less than two weeks until fight night, I'm weighing two main factors: the probability the fight happens as scheduled, and the probability Dvalishvili wins if it does. For the fight happening: At this stage, fighters are typically wrapping up their camps. While last-minute injuries do occur, most scheduled title fights at this point proceed as planned. I estimate approximately 85-90% chance both fighters make it to the octagon. For Dvalishvili winning if the fight happens: He has significant advantages. He already defeated O'Malley decisively by unanimous decision just 8 months ago, demonstrating a clear style advantage with his relentless wrestling and cardio. Joe Rogan's commentary questioning how O'Malley can overcome Dvalishvili's abilities, and Henry Cejudo calling Dvalishvili potentially the greatest bantamweight ever, reflects expert consensus on his dominance. However, MMA rematches can produce different results - O'Malley is an elite striker who could make adjustments, and one well-placed strike can change everything. I estimate Dvalishvili has roughly 60-65% chance to win the rematch if it happens. Combining these probabilities (0.87 × 0.63 ≈ 0.55), I arrive at approximately 56%. This isn't higher because: injury risks remain with 12 days to go, O'Malley is a dangerous striker who could catch Dvalishvili, and the question resolves No if the fight doesn't happen. This isn't lower because: Dvalishvili's proven dominance over O'Malley is a strong indicator, the fight is very close and likely to proceed, and the champion typically has the advantage in rematches.

prompt:
You are a professional forecaster interviewing for a job.

Your interview question is:
Will Merab Dvalishvili defeat Sean O'Malley at UFC 316?

Question background:
ESPN: [UFC 316: Dvalishvili vs. O'Malley 2](https://www.espn.com/mma/fightcenter/_/id/600053672/league/ufc)


This question's outcome will be determined by the specific criteria below. These criteria have not yet been satisfied:
This question resolves as **Yes** if Merab Dvalishvili defeats Sean O'Malley at [UFC 316](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UFC_316).

If Dvalishvili does not fight anyone at UFC 316 or fights someone else, this resolves as No.


Your research assistant's report says:
This is a rematch for the UFC bantamweight title, scheduled to headline UFC 316 on June 7-8, 2025, in Newark, New Jersey. In their first fight at UFC 306 in September 2024, Merab Dvalishvili defeated Sean O'Malley by unanimous decision to win the championship. Commentator Joe Rogan has questioned how O'Malley gets past Dvalishvili's abilities, and former champion Henry Cejudo has referred to Dvalishvili as the greatest bantamweight of all time.

Today is 2025-05-26.

Before answering you think:
(a) The time left until the outcome to the question is known.
(b) The status quo outcome if nothing changed.
(c) A brief description of a scenario that results in a No outcome.
(d) A brief description of a scenario that results in a Yes outcome.
(e) You write your rationale remembering that good forecasters put extra weight on the status quo outcome since the world changes slowly most of the time. Explain your reasoning and the evidence behind your forecast in detail. Summarise information your received from your research assistant that influences your forecast (if any). Explain why your forecast is not higher, and why it is not lower. Outline what would need to be true for you to update your forecast in either direction.
(f) The last thing you write is your final probabilistic forecast as a number between 0 and 100.

# OUTPUT SCHEMA
{
    "time_left_until_outcome_known": "string",
    "status_quo_outcome": "string",
    "no_outcome_scenario": "string",
    "yes_outcome_scenario": "string",
    "rationale": "string",
    "probability": "number" (0-100)
}
